title: Mumbai boat accident: Parents on ferry thought of ‘tossing children into sea water’, says CISF jawan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mumbai ferry accident: 14 people were killed after a Navy boat rammed into the tourist ferry on way to the Elephanta Island from the Gateway of India in Mumbai.

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

On December 18, a tourist ferry sank off the Mumbai coast, leading to a tragic loss of life and intense panic among passengers. CISF personnel played a crucial role in steering the rescue efforts.

  • Fourteen people confirmed dead after collision with Indian Navy boat.
  • CISF constable and team prioritized saving vulnerable individuals, especially children.
  • Approximately 50-60 people rescued from the sinking ferry.
  • Rescue efforts included CPR for 10-12 victims by CISF personnel.
“We saw people were ready to throw their children in the ocean water thinking that they would be saved from the sinking ship.” - CISF constable Amol Savant

The rapid response from the CISF and the bravery of rescuers prevented further tragedy, underscoring the need for effective maritime safety measures.
newTitle: Mumbai Ferry Accident: Heroic Rescues Amid Panic as 14 Lives Lost

title: "Our Recollections Differ": Shashi Tharoor On Hardeep Puri's George Soros Claim - NDTV
summary:
Tharoor and Puri Clash Over George Soros Dinner Invitation

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has denied Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri's assertions regarding the inclusion of billionaire George Soros in a 2009 dinner invitation list. The two politicians share differing recollections of the event.

  • Tharoor claims he was unaware of any connection between Soros and India at the time.
  • Puri insists that Tharoor was responsible for the invite list, including Soros.
  • The discussion resurfaced after a BJP worker highlighted a 2009 post by Tharoor about Soros.
“Our recollections differ, dear Hardeep…” — Shashi Tharoor

The exchange highlights contrasting memories of diplomatic interactions during Tharoor's tenure as Minister of State for External Affairs.
newTitle: Tharoor and Puri Clash Over George Soros Dinner Invitation

title: Srinagar records coldest Dec night in over three decades as Chillai-Kalan arrives in Kashmir - Greater Kashmir
100 Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Part 1 [1-25] - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
100 Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Part 1 [1-25]

Publication Date: 2024

Source: LiveLaw

As is the annual tradition, LiveLaw brings to you the list of 100 important Supreme Court judgments of the current year - a much-awaited article by our dear readers. The judgments are selected based on their importance to the general public, settlement of legal positions, and their utility for practitioners.

The list of 100 judgments will be published in four parts; this is the first part.

  • Supreme Court Refuses SIT/CBI Probe In Adani-Hindenburg Case; Endorses SEBI Investigation, Regulations
  • Supreme Court Issues Guidelines To HCs On Summoning Govt Officials, Says Personal Presence Should Be Exceptional
  • Supreme Court Sets Aside Remission Of 11 Convicts In Bilkis Bano Case; Asks Them To Surrender In Prison
  • Police Must Inform 'Hit & Run' Accident Victims About Compensation Scheme, Centre Must Consider Increasing Amount: Supreme Court
  • Bribery Not Protected By Legislative Privileges; No Immunity For MPs/MLAs Taking Bribe For Vote/Speech In Legislature
  • Supreme Court Strikes Down Electoral Bonds Scheme As Unconstitutional, Asks SBI To Stop Issuing EBs
  • Supreme Court Requests Parliament To Amend Corresponding Section In Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Regarding Misuse Of 498A IPC
“The judgments included in the list are not necessarily good or the best judgments; some of them are controversial and regarding some others, there are strong counter-views.”

In conclusion, the article highlights the importance of these rulings in shaping legal practices and societal norms throughout the year.
newTitle: 100 Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Part 1 [1-25]

title: Delhi air pollution: What's the AQI today? Toxic smog envelopes NCR | weather updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI today: Toxic smog envelopes NCR

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi's air quality remained toxic on December 21, with average AQI levels in parts of the city hitting alarming figures. The situation posed serious health risks, especially to vulnerable populations.

  • The average AQI in Nehru Nagar was 434, firmly in the 'severe' category.
  • 20 out of 36 monitoring stations reported 'severe' air quality at 8 AM.
  • Hotspots included Anand Vihar (414), Ashok Vihar (423), and Gurugram (425).
  • Health experts advise avoiding outdoor activities for sensitive groups.
  • The India Meteorological Department forecasts dense fog and potential rainfall next week.
"The air quality has significantly deteriorated, posing life-threatening risks for vulnerable populations such as children and the elderly."

The ongoing air pollution crisis in Delhi is exacerbated by weather conditions, highlighting the need for immediate governmental action and public awareness.
newTitle: Delhi's Air Quality Remains Toxic Amid Thick Smog

title: 'Invitees list given by Shashi Tharoor': Hardeep Puri on 2009 dinner with George Soros - The Times of India
summary:
'Our recollections differ': Shashi Tharoor, Hardeep Puri in war of words over 2009 dinner with George Soros in US

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Shashi Tharoor and Hardeep Puri engage in a Twitter spat regarding the details of a 2009 dinner with George Soros, revealing differing accounts of the event.

  • The disagreement arose over claims made by Tharoor regarding the attendees and context of the dinner.
  • Puri challenged Tharoor's recollection, emphasizing the differences in their accounts.
  • This altercation has drawn attention on social media, with both politicians having significant followings.
"Our recollections differ," Tharoor stated, highlighting the discrepancies.

This public dispute reflects ongoing tensions between the two political figures and showcases how historical events can be interpreted differently based on personal perspectives.
newTitle: 'Our recollections differ': Shashi Tharoor, Hardeep Puri in war of words over 2009 dinner with George Soros in US

title: Rainfall in Odisha to continue as well-marked low pressure over Bay of Bengal intensifies into depression - OTV News
summary:
Rainfall in Odisha to Continue as Well-Marked Low Pressure Intensifies

Publication Date: Saturday, Source: Regional Meteorological Department

The well-marked low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal has intensified into a depression, resulting in expected rainfall across Odisha for the next 24 hours.

  • Heavy rainfall is likely in coastal districts including Kendrapara, Jagatsinghpur, Ganjam, and Gajapati.
  • Light to moderate rainfall is forecast for several locations in Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, Jajpur, and Dhenkanal.
  • After 24 hours, improvements in rainfall are expected, although cloudy skies and gusty winds will persist.
  • No significant change in temperature is anticipated over the next two days.
“Wind direction has changed to south-easterly and the winds are carrying a lot of moisture.” - Manorama Mohanty, IMD Bhubaneswar Director

In conclusion, while the immediate forecast indicates continued rain, improvements are anticipated after a day or so, with less severe weather expected moving forward.
newTitle: Rainfall in Odisha to Continue as Well-Marked Low Pressure Intensifies

title: Delhi Man Stabbed To Death, Had Threatened Accused To Return Friend's Money - NDTV
summary:
Delhi Man Stabbed to Death Over Financial Dispute

Date & Source: NDTV, February 2024

Introduction: A 26-year-old man was stabbed to death in Delhi's Narela area over an alleged financial dispute.

  1. The victim, Himanshu, was living with his friend, Sumit Kaushik.
  2. The dispute involved a loan of ₹45,000 that the accused, Ravi, had borrowed from Sumit and failed to return.
  3. Himanshu threatened Ravi's family over the unpaid debt.
  4. Ravi and his accomplices later stabbed Himanshu to death.
Three people have been arrested in the case - Ravi (30), Sahil (24) and Ashish (26). The fourth accused, Akshay Khatri, is reportedly on the run.

Conclusion: The murder is linked to a financial dispute, and the police are investigating the case further.
newTitle: Delhi Man Stabbed to Death Over Financial Dispute

title: Fire breaks out at Salarpuria Sattva Knowledge City building in Hyderabad’s Madhapur - The Hindu
summary:
Fire Breaks Out at Salarpuria Sattva Knowledge City in Hyderabad

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

On the morning of December 21, 2024, a fire broke out in the amenities block of Sattva Elixir building at Knowledge City, HITEC City, prompting a quick response from the Fire Services Department.

  • The fire was reported at 6:12 a.m., leading to the mobilization of four firefighting vehicles.
  • The fire originated on the fourth floor and spread to the other floors, fortunately causing no injuries or casualties.
  • Sattva Group confirmed that operations at Knowledge City continued as usual and that the cause of the fire is still under investigation.
“We appreciate the swift and effective response of both our emergency team and the State Fire Department in managing the situation.”

The fire was quickly detected and extinguished thanks to advanced safety systems and a well-trained emergency response team.
newTitle: Fire Breaks Out at Salarpuria Sattva Knowledge City in Hyderabad

title: Bhagwat blows the whistle on mandir-masjid frenzy. Asks if a crow can sit atop a temple & become an eagle - ThePrint
summary:
Bhagwat Challenges Temple-Mosque Discourse: Calls for Unity

Date: Thursday, Source: The Print

In a speech in Pune, RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat posed a provocative question about a crow sitting on a temple, suggesting it cannot become an eagle. He emphasized the need for a change in discussions surrounding communal relations in India, particularly regarding temple-mosque issues.

  • Bhagwat's remarks call for a pause on disputes over temples and mosques, addressing rising tensions in the Hindi heartland.
  • He criticized individuals who exploit these issues for political gain, likening them to crows hoping to transform into eagles.
  • The idea of India as a 'vishwaguru' was revisited, aligning with a call for unity in diversity.
  • Comments on past assimilation attempts and the harmful impact of historical divisions on current relations were also made.
  • Social media criticism ensued, particularly from hard-right groups, questioning Bhagwat’s stance.
  • The Supreme Court's upcoming decisions regarding the Places of Worship Act remain crucial for this dialogue.
“Only if we can prove this to the world can we become the natural vishwaguru.”

Bhagwat's speech represents a strategic intervention to address internal conflicts within the BJP's base while preserving its reputation amid rising tensions.
newTitle: Bhagwat Challenges Temple-Mosque Discourse: Calls for Unity

title: Farmers Protest | AAP delegation raises Dallewal issue with Punjab Governor - The Hindu
summary:
Farmers Protest | AAP Delegation Raises Dallewal Issue with Punjab Governor

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

A delegation of the Aam Aadmi Party on Friday raised the issue of farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast-unto-death with Punjab Governor Gulab Chand Kataria and urged him to intervene and press the Centre to initiate talks with the protesting farmers.

  • AAP’s Punjab unit president Aman Arora emphasized the need for the farmers' legitimate demands to be fulfilled without delay.
  • Dallewal has been on a fast-unto-death at the Khanauri border demanding legal MSP guarantees.
  • Farmers have been protesting at border points since February after their march to Delhi was halted.
  • The delegation demanded the removal of Union Home Minister Amit Shah over his remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar.
"Farmers are the backbone of our nation. The continuous disregard of their demands and the breaking of past promises by the Central government is a matter of grave concern." - Aman Arora

The AAP is mobilizing to ensure farmers' issues are addressed, highlighting ongoing concerns about Dallewal's health and the broader context of farmer protests.
newTitle: Farmers Protest | AAP Delegation Raises Dallewal Issue with Punjab Governor

title: Watch: Fire in software company near Hitec city in Hyderabad, efforts on to contain - Telangana Today
summary:
Fire Breaks Out at Software Company Near Hitec City in Hyderabad

Date: 21 December 2024, Source: Telangana Today

A fire broke out early Saturday morning at an IT company located in Madhapur, near Hitec City. The blaze rapidly spread through the building, causing thick smoke and panic among onlookers as fire tenders rushed to the scene.

  • Fire started on the fifth floor of the Salarpuria Sattva Knowledge City building.
  • Thick smoke visible from a distance raised alarm among nearby residents.
  • Local police are assisting firefighters in managing the situation.
  • More details are expected to emerge soon.
The fire created a panic among the people.

Efforts are ongoing to contain the fire, and the damage extent is yet to be assessed.
newTitle: Fire Breaks Out at Software Company Near Hitec City in Hyderabad

title: PM Narendra Modi's Kuwait visit from today, to interact with Indian diaspora, meet Emir | Details - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi's Kuwait visit from today, to interact with Indian diaspora, meet Emir | Details

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a two-day visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian premier in over four decades, aimed at enhancing India-Kuwait relations.

  • This visit is expected to “open a new chapter” in India-Kuwait relations.
  • PM Modi will meet the Amir of Kuwait, Crown Prince, and Prime Minister.
  • Key discussions will focus on trade, investment, energy, culture, and people-to-people contacts.
  • He will also visit a labour camp and engage with the Indian diaspora at a community event.
  • The visit aims to strengthen ties with the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).
“It will not only consolidate the partnership in existing spheres but also unveil new avenues for future cooperation.” - Arun Kumar Chatterjee, Secretary (Overseas Indian Affairs)

The visit underscores the importance of India-Kuwait relations, particularly in trade and energy sectors.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi's Historic Visit to Kuwait to Strengthen Ties

title: Chautala’s chequered journey: Five-time CM to Tihar’s oldest inmate - The Tribune India
summary:
Chautala’s chequered journey: Five-time CM to Tihar’s oldest inmate

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: The Tribune

Om Prakash Chautala, a five-time Chief Minister of Haryana, passed away at the age of 89. His life was marked by significant political achievements and controversies, including a long stint in Tihar Jail on corruption charges.

  • Chautala served as Chief Minister multiple times between 1989 and 2005, influencing Jat politics in Haryana.
  • He was sentenced to jail for involvement in a teachers’ recruitment scam and a disproportionate assets case.
  • Despite his legal troubles, he passed his Class XII exam at the age of 82 while incarcerated.
  • His tenure saw notable events such as the 1990 Meham Assembly violence.
  • Chautala's legacy includes challenges with political alliances and the subsequent decline of INLD's power in Haryana.
“A film ‘Dasvi’ was made about Chautala's life, highlighting his educational achievements while in jail.”

Chautala's complex journey reflects the turbulent political landscape of Haryana and the intertwining of personal achievements with public service.
newTitle: Chautala’s Journey: From Chief Minister to Tihar Inmate

title: Supreme Court wants Dallewal shifted to hospital, asks Punjab to take call - The Tribune India
summary:
Supreme Court Calls for Hospital Transfer of Farmer Leader Dallewal

Publication Date: January 2, 2025

Source: The Tribune

The Supreme Court has ordered that farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, currently on an indefinite fast, should be moved to a makeshift hospital near his protest site, leaving the decision in the hands of the Punjab Government.

  1. Dallewal has been fasting since November 26 to press for farmer demands.
  2. The Punjab Government is responsible for Dallewal's health and must assess the need for hospital transfer.
  3. A medical report is required by January 2, 2025, regarding Dallewal's health status.
  4. Authorities have stated they are prepared to transfer him but will respect his consent due to health concerns.
  5. The Supreme Court has previously reprimanded the Punjab Government for not performing adequate medical tests on Dallewal.
  6. Current medical tests show Dallewal's condition is stable, but there are concerns about his health deteriorating.
“It is entirely the responsibility of the state of Punjab to ensure stable health conditions of Dallewal.”

The Supreme Court's intervention underscores the importance of addressing health concerns amid ongoing protests, reflecting the delicate balance between civil rights and health safety.
newTitle: Supreme Court Calls for Hospital Transfer of Farmer Leader Dallewal

title: Crime Branch to investigate BJP’s FIR against Rahul, Congress complaint - The Indian Express
summary:
Crime Branch to Investigate BJP’s FIR Against Rahul Gandhi

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: Indian Express

The Delhi Police has transferred the investigation of an FIR lodged against Rahul Gandhi following a scuffle in Parliament where two BJP MPs were injured, to the Crime Branch.

  • The FIR against Gandhi is under sections concerning causing grievous hurt, use of criminal force, and intimidation.
  • The Congress party has also filed a complaint against BJP MPs regarding the incident.
  • Investigation will cover both complaints as the Crime Branch begins its inquiry.
  • The Congress has demanded the release of CCTV footage of the incident and reiterated calls for the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah.
“In the history of democracy, this has happened for the first time.” - Pramod Tiwari

The ongoing investigation highlights significant political tensions and divisions within parliament, as both parties trade accusations amid an increasingly contentious winter session.
newTitle: Crime Branch to Investigate BJP's FIR Against Rahul Gandhi

title: 'Punjab Govt Would Be Responsible': Supreme Court's Direction On Farmer Leader Jagjit Dallewal's Health - News18
summary:
Supreme Court Directs Punjab Government to Ensure Farmer Leader Jagjit Dallewal's Health

Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: News18

The Supreme Court has ordered the Punjab government to take immediate action to ensure the safety and health of farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on an indefinite hunger strike. His health has critically deteriorated recently.

  • The Supreme Court's directives come after Dallewal lost consciousness during his hunger strike.
  • The Punjab government is required to transfer him to a makeshift hospital for constant monitoring.
  • Dallewal has been on hunger strike for 24 days and his condition is described as critical.
  • Political leaders have urged the government to meet the farmers' demands to alleviate Dallewal's situation.
The court stated, "The Punjab government would be responsible for Dallewal’s health."

This situation highlights the ongoing farmers' protests and their struggle for rights, particularly regarding the demands addressed to the Indian government.
newTitle: Supreme Court Directs Punjab Government to Ensure Farmer Leader Jagjit Dallewal's Health

title: PM Modi’s Kuwait trip to begin today with labour camp visit; to meet Emir - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi’s Kuwait trip to begin today with labour camp visit; to meet Emir

Publication Date: 21-12-2024 Source: The Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to start his two-day visit to Kuwait, focusing on the Indian labour force and bilateral discussions on trade and investment.

  • PM Modi will visit an Indian labour camp to express solidarity with Indian workers in Kuwait.
  • This is the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister to Kuwait in 43 years.
  • Meetings are scheduled with the Emir and Crown Prince of Kuwait for bilateral talks.
  • Arun Kumar Chatterjee emphasized the importance of the visit for Indian workers and diaspora.
  • Kuwait is a key trading partner for India, with significant investments and trade relations.
“This marks the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister to Kuwait in 43 years and therefore assumes considerable significance.” - Arun Kumar Chatterjee

The visit highlights the long-standing ties between India and Kuwait, with potential for enhanced cooperation in multiple sectors.
newTitle: PM Modi's Historic Visit to Kuwait: Focusing on Labour and Bilateral Relations

title: Chaotic winter session ends: Lok Sabha worked for 57% of the time, Rajya Sabha for 43% - The Times of India
summary:
Chaotic winter session ends: Lok Sabha worked for 57% of the time, Rajya Sabha for 43%

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

The winter session of Parliament saw the Lok Sabha functioning for 57% of its scheduled time while the Rajya Sabha worked for only 43%, highlighting significant inefficiencies during the session.

  • Lok Sabha had a productive engagement rate of 57%.
  • Rajya Sabha's productivity was notably lower at 43%.
  • Discussions were chaotic, reflecting poor legislative performance.
"The productivity of Parliament remains a matter of concern, with both houses struggling to meet their schedules effectively."

In conclusion, the winter session's outcomes reveal a pressing need for reforms to improve parliamentary efficiency and effectiveness.
newTitle: Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha Winter Session Results

title: Priyanka Gandhi bristles as BJP MP gifts her 'Sikh genocide' bag - The Times of India
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi bristles as BJP MP gifts her 'Sikh genocide' bag

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

Priyanka Gandhi expressed her anger when she received a bag labeled with references to the Sikh genocide from a BJP MP, showcasing the ongoing tensions in Indian politics regarding religious sentiments.

  • The BJP MP presented the gift during a public event.
  • Priyanka Gandhi's response highlighted political sensitivity around communal issues.
  • The incident sparked reactions on social media, with many discussing the appropriateness of the gift.
"This type of commentary and provocations are harmful to communal harmony in our country."

This incident reveals the fraught nature of political discourse in India, particularly as it pertains to the sensitive subject of religious histories.

title: Phone dropped in hundi by accident, temple claims it in Tamil Nadu - The Times of India
summary:
Phone Dropped in Hundi by Accident, Temple Claims It in Tamil Nadu

Publication Date: Date unknown | Source: Unspecified

A phone accidentally dropped in a hundi (donation box) at a temple has sparked a claim from the temple authorities. The incident highlights the intersection of spirituality and technology in modern society.

  • The phone was reportedly dropped by a devotee.
  • Temple officials are asserting their right to the device.
  • This incident raises questions about lost items in religious contexts.
"This situation demonstrates the unexpected blend of faith and everyday technology," remarked a local observer.

The incident reflects broader themes regarding the interaction of personal belongings with cultural practices, particularly within religious settings.

title: Temperatures dip below 0°C across Kashmir - Greater Kashmir
Jaipur gas tanker explosion: Man in flames walked 600m seeking help, but people just recorded videos - The Times of India
16-Year-Old JEE Student From Bihar Found Hanging From Fan In Kota: Police - NDTV
summary:
16-Year-Old JEE Student From Bihar Found Hanging From Fan In Kota: Police

Date: December 23, 2022 | Source: NDTV

A 16-year-old boy from Bihar was discovered hanging from the ceiling fan of his hostel room in Kota, Rajasthan, while preparing for the IIT-JEE exams. Despite measures to prevent such tragedies, he was found dead in a suspected suicide case.

  • The incident occurred in the Vigyan Nagar area of Kota.
  • Police suspect suicide but no note was found.
  • This is the 17th suicide case among coaching students in Kota this year.
  • The boy had been studying in Kota since April.
  • There were 26 reported suicides by students in Kota in 2023.
“It is a shocking incident, and we are investigating the circumstances surrounding it.” - Mukesh Meena, Circle Inspector

This tragic incident highlights the increasing mental health challenges faced by students in high-pressure academic environments.
newTitle: Tragic Death of 16-Year-Old JEE Student in Kota

title: 39-member JPC to examine One Nation One Election bills formed - Hindustan Times
summary:
39-Member JPC to Examine One Nation One Election Bills Formed

Publication Date: Friday, Source: Hindustan Times

New Delhi: The Lok Sabha approved a 39-member joint parliamentary committee (JPC) to examine two significant bills aimed at implementing simultaneous state and national elections.

  • The committee's formation follows requests from smaller parties for representation.
  • Parliamentary minister Kiren Rijiju stated that including prominent political parties was crucial.
  • The JPC will consist of 27 Lok Sabha MPs and 12 Rajya Sabha members.
  • The panel is expected to report by the last week of the 2025 budget session.
  • Opposition parties have expressed concerns about the proposals impacting democratic accountability.
“The government agreed that the matter is very important and it relates to the reformation of the election process of our country...” - Kiren Rijiju

The establishment of the JPC reflects the government's commitment to reforming the electoral process, despite facing opposition. However, the passage of the bills may encounter challenges in the House.
newTitle: 39-Member JPC Formed to Examine One Nation One Election Bills

title: OP Chautala: Jat strongman and five-time Haryana chief minister - Hindustan Times
summary:
Om Prakash Chautala: A Political Legacy in Haryana

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Om Prakash Chautala, the five-time Chief Minister of Haryana, passed away at the age of 89, leaving behind a significant political legacy marked by both achievements and controversies.

  • Chautala served five terms as Chief Minister over a span of five decades.
  • His longest tenure lasted five years, from March 2, 2000, to February 5, 2005.
  • He was known for imposing unpopular taxes that contributed to Haryana’s financial health.
  • His career was marred by controversies, including criminal convictions and family disputes leading to a split in his political party.
  • Chautala's political influence diminished with the rise of the Jannayak Janta Party formed by his son and grandsons.
“When it came to running the government, his abilities were second to none. No one could take him for a ride.” - Sampat Singh, former cabinet colleague.

Chautala's legacy remains a complex tapestry of strong leadership intertwined with legal and political challenges, profoundly impacting Haryana's political landscape.
newTitle: Om Prakash Chautala: A Political Legacy in Haryana

title: Parliament Adjourned Sine Die, 'One Nation, One Election' Bills Referred to Joint Committee - News18
summary:
Parliament Adjourned Sine Die, 'One Nation, One Election' Bills Referred to Joint Committee

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: News18

Both Houses of the Parliament were adjourned sine die following Opposition protests over Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s remarks concerning BR Ambedkar. The 'One Nation, One Election' bills were also referred to a Joint Parliamentary Committee.

  • The Lok Sabha adjourned indefinitely amid protests from the Opposition.
  • The 'One Nation, One Election' bills were referred to a Joint Parliamentary Committee.
  • The Speaker of Lok Sabha warned members against demonstrations in Parliament.
  • The productivity of the Rajya Sabha session was noted to be only 40.03%.
  • Discussions include the implications of simultaneous elections.
“As Parliamentarians, we are drawing severe criticism from the people of India and rightfully so. These persistent disruptions are steadily eroding public trust in our democratic institutions.”

In conclusion, the adjournment of Parliament reflects the ongoing tensions between the Government and the Opposition, particularly regarding significant policy proposals like 'One Nation, One Election' which are still under discussion.
newTitle: Parliament Adjourned Sine Die, 'One Nation, One Election' Bills Referred to Joint Committee

title: Om Prakash Chautala dies: Haryana government declares school holiday today - India TV News
summary:
Om Prakash Chautala dies: Haryana government declares school holiday today

Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: India TV News

The government of Haryana has declared December 21 a school holiday in remembrance of former Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala, who passed away on December 20.

  • The Haryana government declared a three-day state mourning from December 20 to 22.
  • All state government functions will be cancelled during this mourning period.
  • A state funeral will be held for Chautala on December 21 at 3:00 PM in Teja Khera, Sirsa.
  • Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini praised Chautala's contributions and leadership.
“With his demise, a chapter of Haryana politics has come to an end. His contribution to Haryana politics will always be remembered.” – CM Nayab Singh Saini

Chautala's death is marked by tributes from political figures who recognized his influence in Haryana politics.
newTitle: Om Prakash Chautala dies: Haryana government declares school holiday today

title: Private Bus Destroyed In Jaipur Fire Did Not Have Permit: RTO - NDTV
India Lodges Protest With Bangladesh Over 'Map' Post By Muhammad Yunus Aide - NDTV
